articles.title: Message of Thanks to Kim Jong Il from Indonesian Party Leaders
articles.content:
Message of Thanks to Kim Jong Il from Indonesian Party Leaders
						

					 Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a message of thanks on Sept. 23 from Chairman Andreas Hugo Pareira and Secretary General Tjahjo Kumolo of the Central Directive Council of the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle.
					
					 The message expressed thanks for the successful visit to the DPRK by the delegation of the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle led by General Chairwoman of its Central Directive Council Megawati Soekarnoputri.
					
					 Both sides exchanged views on the issues of mutual concern at the talks held in a friendly atmosphere, the message said, adding that the Workers' Party of Korea is a great party as it has wisely led the struggle for building socialism and independence of the nation under the banner of the Juche idea.
					
					 The Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle hopes that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries and the two parties will grow stronger, the message noted.

articles.title: Food Aid to DPRK from Russian Government
articles.content:
Food Aid to DPRK from Russian Government 
						

					 Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- The delivery of the Russian government's food aid to the DPRK through the World Food Programme (WFP) was over. 
					
					 A presentation ceremony was held at the Pyongyang Flour-Processing Factory on Tuesday.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Kim Ji Sok, vice-minister of Food Procurement and Administration, officials concerned, Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Valery E. Sukhinin and the delegation of the Russian Ministry of Extraordinary Situation led by Oleg Belaventsev, director of the Agency for Support and Coordination of Russian Participation in International Humanitarian Operations of the ministry, and Abdurrahim Siddiqui, acting representative of WFP in the DPRK.
					
					 After Kim Ji Sok and Oleg Belaventsev signed the document, speeches were made.
					
					 The Russian government's humanitarian aid is a manifestation of the traditional friendly relations between the two countries.

articles.title: Russian Delegation Pays Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Russian Delegation Pays Homage to Kim Il Sung 
						

					 Pyongyang, October 4 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Russian Ministry of Extraordinary Situation led by Oleg Belaventsev, director of the Agency for Support and Coordination of Russian Participation in International Humanitarian Operations, visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Tuesday to pay tribute to President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 They made deep bows in boundless reverence to Kim Il Sung, who made an immortal contribution to the development of the DPRK-Russia friendly relations.
					
					 Oleg Belaventsev wrote in the visitor's book that the delegation pays high tribute to Kim Il Sung and sincerely wishes the people of the DPRK successes in their efforts for bright future.
